function_call.name: classify_risks_framework
function_call.arguments: {"sorted_risks":[{"name":"Virus transmission through surfaces and human-building interactions","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Uncertainty about virus transmission via surfaces and the effectiveness of prevention measures","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Lack of proper ventilation strategies leading to poor air quality","category":"Structures","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Privacy concerns related to non-wearable sensor systems","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Intrusiveness and effectiveness of wearable sensor systems","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Ineffective use of wearable sensors ws leading to limited disease monitoring and control.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Dependence on large-scale datasets for ai models, which may not always be available or reliable.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Lack of incorporation of domain knowledge in data-driven ai models leading to suboptimal performance in disease monitoring and control.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Lack of common standards and guidelines for evaluating healthy building design, construction, and operation.","category":"Society","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Insufficient understanding of the strengths and weaknesses of new standards and guidelines.","category":"Society","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Lack of emergency preparedness guidelines for buildings in extreme events, such as infectious disease pandemics.","category":"Society","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Limited understanding of the link between building and occupant parameters and their impacts on physical, mental, and social health","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Limited generalizability and longitudinal studies in existing research on occupant health in buildings","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Siloed expertise in building science community and lack of integrated understanding of lighting, air, noise, and temperature impacts on occupants","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Cost barrier for real-time ieq measurements","category":"Structures","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Privacy risks and security breaches from iot devices and data collection","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Capital cost associated with introducing iot and intelligent furniture in healthy buildings","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Increased use of voice-activated interfaces may contribute to the spread of contagious diseases by facilitating surface contact.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Inadequate spatial arrangements and movement restrictions may lead to crowding and increased transmission of contagious diseases.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Use of antibacterial fabrics and finishes may lead to a false sense of security and reduce adherence to proper hygiene practices.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Potential for virus transmission through ventilation systems and building materials","category":"Structures","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Uncertainty in quantifying the impact of new strategies and technologies on the economy, social goals, and environmental goals","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Risk of prolonged indoor exposure leading to reduced physical and mental health","category":"Structures","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Buildings as a vector for contagious diseases transmission","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Lack of common standards for building design to support health","category":"Society","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Lack of interdisciplinary approach to understanding health implications of buildings","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Pandemic diseases transcending international borders","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Transmission of diseases through various sources circulation, respiration/air, human/animal body, water, clothing, surfaces","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Historical precedent of quarantine in epidemic control","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Virus transmission in built environments","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Impact of home quarantine","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Lack of contact with hands, minimizing contact with door handles and elevator buttons can reduce the risk of contamination specifically for covid-19.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Ventilating/cleaning clothes worn outside, washing hands with soap for a long time, and ventilating spaces are important measures to reduce the risk of covid-19 transmission.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Relationship of the house with the exterior, including windows and balconies, has been important during the pandemic for visual and auditory socialization and well-being.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Inadequate isolation and quarantine facilities for infected individuals","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Poor ventilation and sunlight in housing structures","category":"Structures","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Inadequate disinfection measures for contaminated items and spaces","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Balconies as places for communication and social activities may facilitate the spread of contagious diseases between neighbors and residents.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Balconies as areas for observation and leisure activities can lead to close proximity and interaction between individuals, increasing the risk of contagious disease transmission.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Use of balconies for daily activities like drying laundry and storing items can potentially spread contaminants or pathogens in the air or on surfaces.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Cooperation and interaction in residential balconies can lead to the spread of contagious diseases.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Aesthetic use of balconies can lead to overcrowding and close proximity, increasing the risk of disease transmission.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Balconies used as smoking places","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Closure of balconies as a privacy mechanism","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Lack of communication due to closed balconies","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Inadequate ventilation due to balcony design and configuration","category":"Structures","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Lack of privacy and social distancing on balconies","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Inadequate performance evaluation of the balcony space","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Poor ventilation and air circulation on the balcony can contribute to the spread of contagious diseases.","category":"Structures","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Lack of privacy on the balcony may lead to behaviors that increase the risk of disease transmission, such as talking loudly and playing loud music.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"}]}
